from flask import Blueprint, jsonify, request
from models import Vehicle
from extensions import db
from sqlalchemy.exc import SQLAlchemyError
import logging
from marshmallow import Schema, fields, ValidationError

bp = Blueprint('fleet', __name__, url_prefix='/api/v1/fleet')

logging.basicConfig(level=logging.ERROR)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

class VehicleSchema(Schema):
    id = fields.Integer(dump_only=True)
    name = fields.String(required=True)
    status = fields.String(required=True)
    location = fields.String(required=True)

@bp.route('/vehicles', methods=['GET'])
def get_vehicles():
    """
    Retrieve all vehicles
    ---
    responses:
      200:
        description: A list of all vehicles
      500:
        description: Internal server error
    """
    try:
        vehicles = Vehicle.query.all()
        vehicle_schema = VehicleSchema(many=True)
        return jsonify(vehicle_schema.dump(vehicles)), 200
    except SQLAlchemyError as e:
        logger.error(f"Database error in get_vehicles: {str(e)}")
        return jsonify({"error": "An error occurred while fetching vehicles"}), 500

# Keep the existing routes (task, status) in the file

from flask import Blueprint, jsonify, request
from models import Vehicle, MaintenanceTask
from extensions import db
from sqlalchemy.exc import SQLAlchemyError
import logging
from marshmallow import Schema, fields, ValidationError

bp = Blueprint('fleet', __name__, url_prefix='/fleet')

logging.basicConfig(level=logging.ERROR)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

class TaskSchema(Schema):
    vehicle_id = fields.Integer(required=True)
    task_type = fields.String(required=True)
    description = fields.String(required=True)

@bp.route('/vehicles', methods=['GET'])
def get_vehicles():
    """
    Retrieve real-time vehicle data
    ---
    responses:
      200:
        description: A list of vehicles
      500:
        description: Internal server error
    """
    try:
        vehicles = Vehicle.query.all()
        return jsonify([{
            'id': v.id,
            'name': v.name,
            'status': v.status,
            'location': v.location
        } for v in vehicles])
    except SQLAlchemyError as e:
        logger.error(f"Database error in get_vehicles: {str(e)}")
        return jsonify({'error': 'A database error occurred. Please try again later or contact support.'}), 500

@bp.route('/task', methods=['POST'])
def assign_task():
    """
    Assigns maintenance or rebalancing tasks
    ---
    parameters:
      - name: vehicle_id
        in: body
        required: true
        type: integer
      - name: task_type
        in: body
        required: true
        type: string
      - name: description
        in: body
        required: true
        type: string
    responses:
      201:
        description: Task assigned successfully
      400:
        description: Bad request
      404:
        description: Vehicle not found
      500:
        description: Internal server error
    """
    try:
        schema = TaskSchema()
        try:
            data = schema.load(request.json)
        except ValidationError as err:
            return jsonify({'error': 'Invalid input', 'details': err.messages}), 400

        vehicle = Vehicle.query.get(data['vehicle_id'])
        if not vehicle:
            return jsonify({'error': 'Vehicle not found', 'details': f"No vehicle with id {data['vehicle_id']}"}), 404

        if data['task_type'] not in ['maintenance', 'rebalancing']:
            return jsonify({'error': 'Invalid task type', 'details': "Task type must be 'maintenance' or 'rebalancing'"}), 400

        task = MaintenanceTask(
            vehicle_id=data['vehicle_id'],
            description=data['description'],
            status='Pending'
        )
        db.session.add(task)
        db.session.commit()

        return jsonify({'message': 'Task assigned successfully', 'task_id': task.id}), 201
    except SQLAlchemyError as e:
        logger.error(f"Database error in assign_task: {str(e)}")
        db.session.rollback()
        return jsonify({'error': 'A database error occurred. Please try again later or contact support.'}), 500

@bp.route('/status', methods=['GET'])
def get_fleet_status():
    """
    Monitors vehicle statuses (live, out of service, etc.)
    ---
    responses:
      200:
        description: Fleet status
      500:
        description: Internal server error
    """
    try:
        vehicles = Vehicle.query.all()
        status_count = {
            'live': 0,
            'out_of_service': 0,
            'maintenance': 0
        }
        for vehicle in vehicles:
            if vehicle.status in status_count:
                status_count[vehicle.status] += 1
            else:
                status_count[vehicle.status] = 1

        return jsonify({
            'total_vehicles': len(vehicles),
            'status_breakdown': status_count
        })
    except SQLAlchemyError as e:
        logger.error(f"Database error in get_fleet_status: {str(e)}")
        return jsonify({'error': 'A database error occurred. Please try again later or contact support.'}), 500

from models import Vehicle
from extensions import db
from sqlalchemy.exc import SQLAlchemyError
import logging
from marshmallow import Schema, fields, ValidationError

bp = Blueprint('fleet', __name__, url_prefix='/api/v1/fleet')

logging.basicConfig(level=logging.ERROR)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

class VehicleSchema(Schema):
    id = fields.Integer(dump_only=True)
    name = fields.String(required=True)
    status = fields.String(required=True)
    location = fields.String(required=True)

@bp.route('/vehicles', methods=['GET'])
def get_vehicles():
    """
    Retrieve all vehicles
    ---
    responses:
      200:
        description: A list of all vehicles
      500:
        description: Internal server error
    """
    try:
        vehicles = Vehicle.query.all()
        vehicle_schema = VehicleSchema(many=True)
        return jsonify(vehicle_schema.dump(vehicles)), 200
    except SQLAlchemyError as e:
        logger.error(f"Database error in get_vehicles: {str(e)}")
        return jsonify({"error": "An error occurred while fetching vehicles"}), 500

@bp.route('/vehicles', methods=['POST'])
def create_vehicle():
    """
    Create a new vehicle
    ---
    parameters:
      - name: vehicle
        in: body
        required: true
        schema:
          $ref: '#/definitions/Vehicle'
    responses:
      201:
        description: Vehicle created successfully
      400:
        description: Invalid input
      500:
        description: Internal server error
    """
    try:
        vehicle_schema = VehicleSchema()
        data = vehicle_schema.load(request.json)
    except ValidationError as err:
        return jsonify({"error": "Invalid input", "details": err.messages}), 400

    try:
        new_vehicle = Vehicle(**data)
        db.session.add(new_vehicle)
        db.session.commit()
        return jsonify(vehicle_schema.dump(new_vehicle)), 201
    except SQLAlchemyError as e:
        logger.error(f"Database error in create_vehicle: {str(e)}")
        db.session.rollback()
        return jsonify({"error": "An error occurred while creating the vehicle"}), 500

def create_vehicle():
    """
    Create a new vehicle
    ---
    parameters:
      - name: vehicle
        in: body
        required: true
        schema:
          $ref: '#/definitions/Vehicle'
    responses:
      201:
        description: Vehicle created successfully
      400:
        description: Invalid input
      500:
        description: Internal server error
    """
    try:
        vehicle_schema = VehicleSchema()
        data = vehicle_schema.load(request.json)
    except ValidationError as err:
        return jsonify({"error": "Invalid input", "details": err.messages}), 400

    try:
        new_vehicle = Vehicle(**data)
        db.session.add(new_vehicle)
        db.session.commit()
        return jsonify(vehicle_schema.dump(new_vehicle)), 201
    except SQLAlchemyError as e:
        logger.error(f"Database error in create_vehicle: {str(e)}")
        db.session.rollback()
        return jsonify({"error": "An error occurred while creating the vehicle"}), 500

# Keep any other existing routes in the file

plan_steps.description: Build the initial prototype
plan_steps.summary: Built the initial prototype of the Lattis API Sandbox, including a Flask backend with API endpoints for fleet management, maintenance, rebalancing, user management, reporting, and integration. Created a user-friendly frontend to interact with these endpoints.

plan_steps.description: Implement remaining API endpoints from all categories
plan_steps.summary: Implemented and verified all remaining API endpoints across all categories, including Fleet Management, Maintenance & Repair, Rebalancing & Optimization, User & Access Management, Data & Reporting, Integration, and Future-Ready Modules.

plan_steps.description: Add more sophisticated error handling and input validation
plan_steps.summary: Added more sophisticated error handling and input validation across the application, including marshmallow schemas for input validation, improved error messages, logging, and global exception handling.

plan_steps.description: Enhance the user interface with more interactive features and visualizations
plan_steps.summary: Enhanced the user interface with interactive features and visualizations, including an interactive fleet map with zoom and pan functionality, real-time updates, data visualization charts (Vehicle Status Distribution, Maintenance Tasks Over Time, and Vehicle Utilization Rate), improved API testing interface with syntax highlighting and save/load functionality, endpoint search functionality, and a dark mode toggle.

plan_steps.description: Improve the UI/UX of the Lattis API Sandbox
plan_steps.summary: Improved the UI/UX of the Lattis API Sandbox by enhancing the visual design, adding new features like dark mode and interactive fleet map, improving the API testing interface, and implementing better user feedback mechanisms. Updated CSS, HTML, and JavaScript files to create a more modern, functional, and user-friendly interface.
